intro: Idanthisa, commonly known as the common hawksbeard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow ray flowers and a central disk of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant typically grows in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, showcasing its adaptability to various environments. Its leaves are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Idanthisa is a hardy perennial that thrives in temperate climates and is often found in the wild across Europe and parts of Asia.
